definition: Leibniz (name)/Gottfriend Wilhelm von Leibniz (1646-1716), German mathematician and philosopher, co-inventor of the calculus
name of weed plant (fat hen, goosefoot, pigweed etc)/Chenopodium album
cloth/to declare/to announce/to spread/to make known
Buddhist nun/(often used in phonetic spellings)
Caltrop or puncture vine (Tribulus terrestris)/to thatch (a roof)

sentences.english: This very slowly converging series was known to Leibniz in 1674.
sentences.chinese: 這個收斂很慢的級數是萊布尼茨在1674年得到的。

sentences.english: The era of national study of Labneits has come.
sentences.chinese: 中國全面研究萊布尼茨的時代已經到來。

sentences.english: The contemporary circumstances for Labneits is full of contradictions.
sentences.chinese: 萊布尼茨在當代的境遇是個矛盾。

sentences.english: Leibnitz came along and turned Newton's definition upside down.
sentences.chinese: 萊布尼茨把牛頓的定義顛倒了過來。

sentences.english: Leibniz occupies a prominent place in the history of mathematics and the history of philosophy.
sentences.chinese: 萊布尼茨在數學史和哲學史上都佔有重要地位。

sentences.english: In 1686, Leibniz published the first calculus literature.
sentences.chinese: 1686年，萊布尼茨發表了第一篇積分學的文獻。
